snippet: Investigators were trying to determine the cause of a train accident along one of the sharpest curves in the Metro-North system that injured more than 60 passengers and killed four.
abstract: Early-morning train from Poughkeepsie, NY, derails in the Bronx, killing four people and injuring more than 60; investigators continue to seek cause of accident, which occurred on one of the sharpest curves in the Metro-North system; is worst accident in Metro-North's 30-year history, and the first with fatalities.

byline.original: By JAMES BARRON and J. DAVID GOODMAN
byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Jack Begg, Joseph Berger, Andrew Boryga, Annie Correal, Stephen Farrell, Emma G. Fitzsimmons, Joseph Goldstein, Thomas Kaplan, Corey Kilgannon, Kate Pastor, William K. Rashbaum, Michael Schwirtz, Julie Turkewitz and Alex Vadukul.

lead_paragraph: Investigators were trying to determine the cause of a train accident along one of the sharpest curves in the Metro-North system that injured more than 60 passengers and killed four.

headline.main: Focus Turns to Investigation in Fatal Bronx Train Crash
headline.print_headline: Derailment in Bronx Kills 4 and Injures Dozens
